title: Google\Cloud\Bigtable\Admin\V2\SnapshotTableRequest
name: SnapshotTableRequest
description:
Request message for [google.bigtable.admin.v2.BigtableTableAdmin.SnapshotTable][google.bigtable.admin.v2.BigtableTableAdmin.SnapshotTable] Note: This is a private alpha release of Cloud Bigtable snapshots. This feature is not currently available to most Cloud Bigtable customers. This feature might be changed in backward-incompatible ways and is not recommended for production use. It is not subject to any SLA or deprecation policy.

Generated from protobuf message google.bigtable.admin.v2.SnapshotTableRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Required. The unique name of the table to have the snapshot taken. Values are of the form projects/{project}/instances/{instance}/tables/{table}.

params.name: data.cluster
params.description: Required. The name of the cluster where the snapshot will be created in. Values are of the form projects/{project}/instances/{instance}/clusters/{cluster}.

params.name: data.snapshot_id
params.description: Required. The ID by which the new snapshot should be referred to within the parent cluster, e.g., mysnapshot of the form: [_a-zA-Z0-9][-_.a-zA-Z0-9]* rather than projects/{project}/instances/{instance}/clusters/{cluster}/snapshots/mysnapshot.

params.name: data.ttl
params.description: The amount of time that the new snapshot can stay active after it is created. Once 'ttl' expires, the snapshot will get deleted. The maximum amount of time a snapshot can stay active is 7 days. If 'ttl' is not specified, the default value of 24 hours will be used.

methods.description:

Values are of the form projects/{project}/instances/{instance}/tables/{table}.
